commentBody:
You're really wrong pointing to SB XII as the "yawn-inducing" Super Bowl that led to rules changes. Consider that game had 37 total points whereas SBs III through IX had an average of 26 points scored. In fact, the REAL snooze-fest was Super Bowl IX with a final score of 16-6 (the sixth time in 7 games the losing team scored 7 or fewer points).

That SB IX led to rules changes in 1975....which culminated in an exciting 21-17 Super Bowl X between Dallas and Pittsburgh. Many NFL historians consider that the first Super Bowl that really transceded being a game and became an "event".
